intro: Xanthisma glaberrimum, commonly known as the smooth sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to hot, dry environments. Its structure includes a low-growing, spreading habit with thick, waxy leaves that help reduce water loss. Xanthisma glaberrimum is often found in desert scrub and rocky habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small organisms.
